The healthiest way to consume chicken is to consume it boiled. Since there is already fat in the chicken, it is much more beneficial for human health not to add additional fat. There are many benefits of consuming boiled chicken. Although it is beneficial to consume chicken, industrial / hormone chickens have a lot of harm. Some of these damages are as follows: Because antibiotics are used on chickens, they allow bacteria to form resistance. This ensures that beneficial bacteria die when it enters the human body. It causes girls to enter puberty at an early age. That's why, let's take care to protect ourselves and our family from hormone and packaged foods, and eat naturally grown chicken meat.

Orange juice is a beverage that improves your health with its important properties such as cancer prevention, fight against free radicals, strengthening the immune system and detoxification. The high level of vitamin C contained in oranges is an important nutrient that cannot be produced by the human body. For this reason, it must be taken from the outside through the diet. Orange juice is also rich in hesperidin, an important antioxidant that reduces the growth of tumors. Orange juice also contains ascorbic acid, one of the key components of collagen. A compound effective in the repair of collagen cells and the growth of new tissues in the body. Therefore, orange juice also plays an important role in delaying premature aging. Orange juice is also rich in vitamin A, which acts as an antioxidant. Moreover, since the juice supports kidney functions, it helps to cleanse the body of toxins. Vitamin A is also a nutrient that protects eye health. By consuming orange juice regularly, you can prevent the onset of many eye diseases such as macular degeneration.

Mushroom, which draws attention with its almost zero fat content, is among the most sought after foods in diet lists, due to its low calorie content, high protein content and no cholesterol. Food with high fiber content is also shown as a rich source of vitamins and minerals. Although the nutritional benefits vary depending on the type, we can talk about the general health benefits of mushrooms. Mushrooms, which contain many antioxidant components, especially selenium, help protect body cells against free radicals that can cause negative health conditions such as heart disease and cancer. It prevents cells from being damaged due to aging and supports the body's defense system against diseases by strengthening the immune system. In addition, we can say that the mushroom has positive effects on cholesterol thanks to the soluble dietary fiber called beta-glucan in its content. Beta-glucan, which plays an effective role in the regulation of blood sugar, also reduces the risk of Type 2 diabetes. Oyster and shiitake species in particular are believed to have the most potent beta-glucans. Mushroom, which is rich in B vitamins such as riboflavin, niacin and pantothenic acid, supports the production of red blood cells and plays an important role in the regulation of the digestive system. The B vitamins contained in this food, which is recommended to be consumed regularly for a healthy skin tissue, also help the nervous system to work regularly. Mushroom, which is also rich in copper, supports body tissues in the production of red blood cells. Copper, which has an important role in ensuring healthy bone structure and nerve conduction, is found in sufficient amounts in those who regularly consume mushrooms. This nutrient, which is a rich source of potassium, which plays an important role in the regular functioning of the heart, muscle and nervous system, has an indispensable place in the diets of vegetarians, thanks to its high protein content.

Bulgur is one of the most beneficial grain groups. Bulgur, which is one of the main food sources of Turkish cuisine, is used in the preparation of all kinds of dishes from pilaf to meatballs, from soup to salad. Wheat, which is one of the sources of carbohydrates, turns into bulgur through various processes and has different varieties such as fine, rice, brown and white. Bulgur, which is one of the indispensable foods of a healthy diet, is rich in protein, minerals, fiber and pulp. One of the most important benefits is that it has an energizing feature thanks to its high carbohydrate value. In addition to providing satiety for a long time, the fiber in its content also supports the regular functioning of the intestinal system. Thanks to the vitamin B1 in its structure, bulgur strengthens the nervous and digestive system, and due to the folic acid it contains, it is one of the foods that should be included in the regular diet of expectant mothers and children in the developmental period during pregnancy. Another benefit of bulgur is that it balances blood sugar. This food, which prevents the rise of bad cholesterol, has a positive effect on vascular health if consumed regularly. Thus, it reduces the risk of vascular diseases such as heart attack and cerebral hemorrhage. One of the most striking positive features of bulgur is that it does not cause weight gain since it has unsaturated fat.
